summary: The law requires the Department of Housing and Urban Development to reduce the risk of lead paint hazards in HUD-assisted housing. Exposure to lead paint can cause brain damage and slow development in children under 6 years. HUD monitors lead paint-related risks in its Project-Based Rental Assistance program that provides subsidies to make privately owned multifamily properties affordable to low-income households. title: Lead Paint in Housing: HUD Has Not Identified High-Risk Project-Based Rental Assistance Properties
